title: Linear and rotation - acceleration from B and C

content.question: A disk rotates about a fixed axis through its center. The angular velocity <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> of the disk as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="omega equals B t plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></math>, where <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math> are constants with appropriate units. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the magnitude of the net acceleration of a point on the disk located a distance <math alttext="r " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> from the axis?

choices.label: <math alttext="r, the square root of, B squared plus C raised to the 4 power, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi><msqrt><msup><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="r, the square root of, B squared plus, open parenthesis, B plus C, close parenthesis, raised to the 4 power, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi><msqrt><msup><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>4</mn></msup></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="r, the square root of, open parenthesis, B plus C, close parenthesis, squared, plus C raised to the 4 power, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi><msqrt><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="r, the square root of, B squared plus C raised to the 4 power, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi><msqrt><msup><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></msqrt></math>
